intro: Epacris × bicolor, commonly known as the golden heath, is a hybrid plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the plant family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Epacris × bicolor is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
